title: Watch: Israeli troops open fire near diplomats visiting West Bank
content: Israeli forces fired warning shots at Italian diplomats near Jenin after they allegedly strayed from an approved route in what the IDF termed an active combat zone. The incident, prompting condemnation and demands for clarification from Italy and the EU, involved diplomats from over 30 countries assessing the humanitarian situation.

title: India declares another Pak diplomat persona non grata
content: India declared a Pakistani official persona non grata. The official was asked to leave within 24 hours. This action follows a previous expulsion of another Pakistani official earlier in May. Tensions rose after India's counterterror operation and strikes on terror launchpads across Pakistan. Pakistan responded with drone incursions. India then destroyed key Pakistani military installations. A ceasefire was later reached.

title: 'Hoodwink attempt': India rejects Pak's Balochistan bus attack claim
content: India has vehemently denied Pakistan's accusations of involvement in the deadly suicide bombing that targeted a school bus in Balochistan's Khuzdar district. The Ministry of External Affairs condemned the attack, expressing condolences while dismissing Pakistan's claims as a diversion from its own internal issues and reputation as a hub of terrorism.

title: JPMorgan Chase to managers: Resist hiring, remember attrition is …
content: JPMorgan Chase is implementing a hiring slowdown, prioritizing efficiency gains through artificial intelligence. The bank anticipates a 10% reduction in operations staff due to AI advancements in areas like fraud and payment processing. While overall headcount growth is being curbed, strategic hiring will continue in key areas such as banking, advising, and branch expansion.

title: 'Criminal conspiracy': ED's big charges against Gandhis in National Herald case
content: The Rouse Avenue court commenced hearing the ED's case against Sonia and Rahul Gandhi in the National Herald matter, focusing on alleged money laundering involving a Rs 90.25 crore loan. The ED argued that Congress party donors were cheated, and Young Indian was a sham entity used to misappropriate assets worth over Rs 2,000 crore.

title: Scotch whisky set to become cheaper in India
content: Diageo Plc anticipates reducing Scotch whisky prices in India following the India-UK FTA, potentially benefiting consumers in the world's largest whisky market. The FTA will slash tariffs, leading to price drops, though the actual impact depends on state taxes and company strategies. While the deal may boost demand, concerns remain about red tape, minimum import pricing, and potential price wars.

title: Nvidia CEO tip to students: If I were a student today, here’s how I would use AI
content: Jensen Huang, Nvidia CEO, advises students to learn artificial intelligence. He emphasizes the importance of interacting with AI tools like ChatGPT. Huang draws a parallel between human interaction and AI prompting. He suggests that effective AI prompting is a crucial skill for all career paths. A report indicates low AI usage among young Americans.

title: Waqf not a fundamental right or essential part of Islam, Centre tells SC
content: The Centre has informed the Supreme Court that waqf, while an Islamic concept, isn't an essential part of Islam and thus can't be claimed as a fundamental right. This statement was made during arguments defending the Waqf (Amendment) Act, 2025, which is being challenged in court.

title: China-Pak economic corridor to expand into Afghanistan: Why it matters for India
content: Pakistan and China agreed to extend the China-Pakistan Economic Corridor to Afghanistan. India consistently opposed this move due to construction in Pakistan-occupied Kashmir. This trilateral meeting occurred after Operation Sindoor. New Delhi raised concerns over terror infrastructure funded by Pakistan. Afghanistan's inclusion raises concerns for India, given existing border issues with China and Pakistan.

title: Denmark's largest construction company returns keys of Tesla cars
content: Danish construction firm Tscherning has divested its entire Tesla fleet, citing Elon Musk's political stances as the primary reason. This decision mirrors a broader trend in Europe, where Tesla's brand image and sales are suffering due to consumer concerns over Musk's political affiliations. The company is opting for European alternatives, highlighting the impact of political views on corporate purchasing decisions.

title: Best football players in the world ranked: Where do Messi and Ronaldo stand?
content: Vinícius Júnior claimed the Best FIFA Men's Player award in 2025, surpassing Lionel Messi and Cristiano Ronaldo in the rankings. The emergence of young talents like Rodri, Jude Bellingham, and Lamine Yamal signals a shift in football's landscape. While Messi and Ronaldo remain influential, rising stars are making their mark, leading to an exciting future for the sport.

title: 'Maoist organisation headless': How a 72-hr op took out top commander
content: In a major anti-Maoist operation, Chhattisgarh's DRG jawans killed 27 Maoists in Abujhmarh forests, Narayanpur. Sources claim CPI (Maoist) general secretary Basava Raju, carrying a Rs 1.5 crore bounty, was among those eliminated. One DRG jawan was also killed in the encounter. The operation followed extensive planning based on intelligence inputs confirming Raju's presence.

title: Walker Buehler gives a fitting reply to Mets’ Francisco Lindor after ejection
content: Tuesday's Mets-Red Sox game was marred by drama and ejections, overshadowing Boston's victory. Walker Buehler's ejection, fueled by Francisco Lindor's on-field behavior and a controversial umpire call, sparked a social media exchange. Buehler criticized Lindor's actions following his ejection, while manager Alex Cora also faced ejection for arguing with the umpire over questionable calls.

title: 'Bangalore Metro Chicks' Instagram page sparks outrage
content: An Instagram account named 'Bangalore Metro Chicks' is facing criticism for allegedly sharing photos and videos of female commuters on Bengaluru's Namma Metro without their permission. The account, which has garnered over 5,000 followers, has prompted outrage, with a social media user alerting the city police

title: Why India is curbing cheap Chinese imports: Explained
content: India is tightening import regulations on household appliances and electronics from China following the discovery of substandard products. The new order mandates Bureau of Indian Standards (BIS) certification for various electrical items, effective March 2026.

title: 'Insult to Army': BJP slams Kharge's 'small war' remark on Op Sindoor
content: BJP MP Sudhanshu Trivedi strongly criticized Congress president Mallikarjun Kharge's description of Operation Sindoor as a "small war," deeming it an insult to the Indian Army's valor and the nation's sentiments. Trivedi accused Kharge and Rahul Gandhi of making anti-India statements as part of a planned conspiracy by the INDIA alliance.

title: 'Rats have become dinosaurs’: Patient’s toes 'gnawed off' in Bihar hosp
content: Nalanda Medical College and Hospital faces scrutiny after a differently-abled patient, Awadhesh Kumar, alleged rat bites on his toes while hospitalized. An inquiry has been initiated following the incident in the orthopaedics ward, prompting strong criticism from the opposition RJD, who highlighted systemic negligence. The hospital administration has promised strict action if negligence is proven.

title: “Naariyal, le lo”: London man selling coconuts in Hindi
content: A British vendor in London is captivating the internet with his enthusiastic sales of 'nariyal paani,' perfectly mimicking the calls of Indian street vendors. Dressed in traditional attire, he brings a taste of India to the UK, creating a viral sensation and fostering cross-cultural joy. His unique approach is not only selling coconuts but also spreading happiness and nostalgia.

title: 'Brahmanon ko bachana hai': Posters appear in Lucknow targetting Akhilesh
content: Following the Samajwadi Party's controversial remarks about UP deputy CM Brajesh Pathak, a poster has emerged in Uttar Pradesh criticising Akhilesh Yadav. The poster, put up by a BJP Yuva Morcha leader, calls for saving Brahmins' honour and ousting Akhilesh. This comes after an FIR was filed over SP's post, deemed offensive to Pathak's late mother.

title: ‘This is India, I’ll speak Hindi, not Kannada’: SBI staffer sparks language row
content: A State Bank of India officer's refusal to speak Kannada to a customer in Karnataka sparked outrage, leading to accusations of Hindi imposition and disrespect for the local language. Following widespread condemnation and a viral video, the officer issued an apology in Kannada. Karnataka's Chief Minister has strongly condemned the incident and urged for language sensitization training for bank staff.

title: SC declines plea for FIR against Justice Yashwant Varma in cash recovery row
content: The Supreme Court dismissed a plea seeking an FIR against Justice Yashwant Varma after the discovery of burnt cash at his residence. The court noted that the CJI had already forwarded the in-house inquiry report and the judge's response to the President and Prime Minister. The petitioners were directed to seek redressal from appropriate authorities before approaching the court again.

title: 'Dog whistling': SC grants interim bail to Ashoka professor, but no stay on probe
content: The Supreme Court granted interim bail to Ashoka University professor Ali Khan Mahmudabad, who was arrested for social media posts concerning Operation Sindoor. The court has ordered the formation of a Special Investigation Team (SIT) to investigate the case. Mahmudabad faces charges under the Bharatiya Nyaya Sanhita, including endangering national integrity, following complaints about his remarks.

title: Brooklyn bridge stands test of time with close calls and collisions
content: The Brooklyn Bridge, a historic New York landmark, has a long history of collisions with ships, dating back to its construction in the 19th century. While many incidents have occurred over the years, a recent collision involving a Mexican Navy ship resulted in the first fatalities related to such an event, claiming two lives and injuring several others.

title: From killer to 'priest': After 2 years, Delhi’s ‘Dr Death’ held from ashram in Raj
content: Dr. Devender Sharma, infamously known as 'Doctor Death,' was apprehended by Delhi police in Rajasthan after absconding while on parole. Sharma, convicted for his involvement in the abduction and murder of truck and taxi drivers, as well as a kidney racket, had been living as a priest in an ashram.

title: 'Ek chawanni chaandi ki ... ': BJP's jibe at Sonia, Rahul over National Herald case
content: The BJP has contrasted the Congress party of Mahatma Gandhi's era with its current leadership, highlighting the National Herald case involving Sonia and Rahul Gandhi. This criticism coincides with the Enforcement Directorate's court submissions, asserting a 'prima facie' money laundering case against the Congress leaders.

title: Drone-like objects spotted over Kolkata, cops probing espionage angle
content: Kolkata police are investigating the appearance of at least ten drone-like objects in the city's night sky. The objects were sighted over areas including Hastings, Vidyasagar Setu, and Maidan on Monday night, raising concerns about potential espionage. The central government has requested a report from the West Bengal government regarding the incident.

title: Sai Sudharsan's power-hitting evolution
content: With 617 runs, Sai Sudharsan is the leading run-scorer in IPL 2025, forging a formidable opening partnership with Shubman Gill for Gujarat Titans. TimesofIndia.com delves deep into how the southpaw worked on his T20 batting with the help of power-hitting coach Shanon Young at the Cricket Performance Lab in Melbourne during the India A tour of Australia in November last year.

title: 'Has she committed murder?' SC grants anticipatory bail to Puja Khedkar in fraud case
content: The Supreme Court granted anticipatory bail to former IAS probationer Puja Khedkar, accused of cheating in the civil services exam by falsely claiming OBC and disability reservation benefits. The Delhi Police and UPSC opposed the bail, alleging fraud. Khedkar faces accusations of submitting false certificates and using different names to bypass exam rules.

title: Who is Ehsan-ur-Rahim alias Danish, the Pakistani official linked to ‘spy’ YouTuber?
content: An official from Pakistan's High Commission in New Delhi, known as Danish, has been implicated in an espionage network. He allegedly recruited Indian nationals, including travel vlogger Jyoti Malhotra, to gather sensitive information and promote pro-Pakistan narratives online. Malhotra, who maintained contact with Pakistani intelligence operatives, is now facing charges under the Official Secrets Act.

title: Yuzvendra Chahal turns fanboy for RJ Mahvash's new show
content: Yuzvendra Chahal, the Punjab Kings' leg-spinner, recently lauded RJ Mahvash's performance in the new Hindi drama series 'Pyaar Paisa Profit' on social media. He shared the show's trailer on his Instagram, expressing his admiration. This appreciation came shortly after Chahal's appearance in the IPL 2025 match against Rajasthan Royals, where Punjab Kings secured a victory.

title: Student cons US couple of $50k, sends money to Ahmedabad via angadia
content: A 25-year-old Indian student in the US has been arrested for allegedly defrauding an elderly Michigan couple of $50,000. The stolen money was reportedly routed to India through angadia and forex companies in Ahmedabad. Authorities suspect a larger network using Indian students as mules in global fraud operations, transferring illicit funds via informal channels.

title: ‘Real feel’ heat rises to nearly 50°C in Delhi
content: Delhi sizzled under intense heat, with the heat index soaring to a scorching 49.6°C, making it feel like 50°C. The rising heat drove peak power demand to a season's high of 7,401 MW. While the IMD forecasts potential thunderstorms and gusty winds until Thursday, high humidity levels are expected to persist, keeping discomfort levels elevated.

title: Seven-day baby among 19 killed in Israeli strike, Hamas claims
content: Israeli strikes in Gaza have resulted in at least 19 fatalities, including a baby, according to the Hamas-controlled civil defense agency. This escalation follows Israel's announcement to take control of the Gaza Strip and the breakdown of ceasefire negotiations in Doha, with both sides blaming each other for the failure.

title: CSK react to 14-year-old Vaibhav Suryavanshi touching MS Dhoni's feet
content: Following Rajasthan Royals' victory over Chennai Super Kings, young Vaibhav Suryavanshi's touching gesture of respect towards MS Dhoni captivated the cricketing world. The 14-year-old, already an IPL sensation after a blistering century, scored a composed 57 in the match. Despite CSK's loss, their shared video of Suryavanshi's humility resonated deeply, reminding fans of cricket's cherished values beyond the game itself.

title: India plans massive $10 bn purchase of ‘over 100 Make in India’ oil tankers
content: India is set to bolster its energy security by acquiring a fleet of 112 locally-built crude carriers by 2040, investing approximately $10 billion. This initiative aims to reduce reliance on foreign vessels and increase the proportion of Indian-built tankers in its fleet, aligning with the nation's goal to expand its refining capacity and become a developed nation by 2047.

title: MI vs DC IPL 2025 match weather report - will it rain?
content: Tonight's crucial IPL clash between Mumbai Indians and Delhi Capitals at Wankhede Stadium faces a major threat: heavy rain. The India Meteorological Department forecasts thunderstorms and gusty winds, with an 80-90% chance of precipitation. A washout would benefit MI, but put DC in a precarious playoff position.

title: When will Sensex hit the 1 lakh mark? Morgan Stanley has a new target
content: Morgan Stanley projects Sensex to reach 89,000 by June 2026, citing India's robust growth and stable policy. A bull case scenario with a 30% probability estimates Sensex hitting 1 lakh, contingent on factors like low oil prices and GST rate cuts.

title: ₹6 crore for RT initiatives in eco-friendly waste management, training
content: Funds allocated for biogas plants for homestays, carbon-neutral packages, training programmes, and publicity campaigns

title: NHRC seeks report from Haryana police on arrest of Ashoka University professor
content: Ali Khan Mahmudabad was arrested by the Haryana police last week on charges, including endangering the sovereignty and integrity of the nation and promoting enmity between different groups

title: A.P. Police to organise AI Hackathon from June 27 to 29
content: DGP Harish Kumar Gupta releases the poster for the hackathon, which will serve as a strategic platform for demonstrating how AI can address real-world challenges in law enforcement and public administration

title: P. Rajeeve calls for a united front against illicit trade
content: Minister emphasises Kerala’s vulnerability to smuggling due to its vibrant industrial and trade sectors, outlines State government’s multi-pronged strategy to counter it

title: Practise yoga daily to a lead healthy life, says Prakasam District Collector
content: Special yoga programmes are being conducted for a month by involving everyone from villages and towns to highlight the benefits of practising yoga everyday

title: Silk Route brought various cultures together, says author
content: Author and retired IPS officer D.V. Guruprasad’s 100th book, Silk Route, released at a function in Belagavi

title: EAM Jaishankar, Danish Minister Bodskov discuss strengthening India-Denmark ties
content: EAM S. Jaishankar appreciated Mr. Frederiksen's guidance in advancing India-Denmark partnership and highlighted the shared commitment to addressing global challenges through sustainable solutions

title: BJP to make stray dog menace a campaign issue ahead of the Thiruvananthapuram Corporation elections
content: Party councillor say the district reports the highest number of dog bite cases in the State. Corporation claims that stray dog population in the city has plummeted from 10,230 in 2016-17 to 8,654 in 2023-24

title: Supreme Court seeks government response on heat wave deaths amid climate crisis
content: Petition highlights failure to implement heat action plans and rising mortality due to climate change

title: Southwest monsoon knocks at the doors of Kerala
content: Though India Meteorological Department has not officially declared the onset, the criteria required for the declaration of the monsoon were met in Kerala on Wednesday

title: Congress leaders throwing baseless allegations at Centre, says Sriramulu
content: The former BJP Minister has said Chief Minister Siddaramaiah announced a ‘sixth guarantee’ during the Hosapete convention in a bid to save his chair

title: Delhi High Court slams Abhijit Iyer-Mitra for posts against Newslaundry journalists, directs their deletion from X
content: “Such a language and words are not permissible in a civilised society. First you remove the posts then we will hear you,” Justice Purushaindra Kumar Kaurav told Mr. Iyer-Mitra’s counsel.

title: Here are the big stories from Karnataka today
content: Welcome to the Karnataka Today newsletter, your guide from The Hindu on the major news stories to follow today. Curated and written by Nalme Nachiyar.

title: After a lull, differences in Syro-Malabar Archdiocese comes to the fore
content: Rebel lay people’s group, which enjoys considerable support in the Archdiocese of the Syro-Malabar Church, says that if it is not possible to unite on mass liturgy, it is better to part ways with mutual understanding

title: Congress says Pahalgam terror attack was security failure, alleges Amit Shah responsible
content: Congress also observed that the country's defence forces were hundred per cent successful but Prime Minister Narendra Modi "failed" as a leader

title: Collector asks officials to submit zonal master plan reports on eco-sensitive zones in Annamayya district within a week
content: Penusila Sanctuary covers 185.42 sq. km across Rajampet and Chitvel mandals and Sri Venkateswara National Park (SVNP) is spread over 87.02 sq. km in Obulavaripalle, Railway Kodur, and Chitvel mandals

title: Ayodhya Ram Darbar consecration on June 5; no Central, State government VIPS invited
content: The trust has also decided that no VIPs, either from the States or the Centre government, will be invited to the ceremony, says Shri Ram Janmabhoomi Construction Committee Chairman Nripendra Misra

title: Karnataka gives trained elephants to Andhra Pradesh to check human-animal conflict
content: This is part of an agreement for exchange of best practices between Karnataka, Andhra Pradesh, Telangana and Kerala to mitigate man-elephant conflict

title: M.A. Saleem is the new DG&IGP of Karnataka
content: Mr. Saleem will replace Dr. Alok Mohan, who retired from service on May 21, as the Head of the Police Force of Karnataka.

title: ‘Law doesn’t recognise concept of marital rape’: Delhi High Court quashes Sec 377 case against husband
content: The court noted Section 377 of IPC penalising such acts won’t apply in a marital relationship particularly when the allegation of consent was missing.

title: Why is India seeking to impose retaliatory tariffs on U.S.? | Explained
content: India retaliates against U.S. tariffs with $7.6 billion worth of reciprocal tariffs, impacting steel and aluminium trade dynamics

title: Provide clarity and announce proper guidelines on Annadata Sukhibhava scheme: A.P. Tenant Farmers Association
content: With the agricultural season about to begin, ₹20,000 should be credited in one instalment into the bank accounts of all tenant farmers in the State to help them with investment needs, says the association

title: In Karnataka, pest attacks make mangoes sourer for farmers as prices drop
content: Farmers from Kolar and Ramanagara said that hoppers which suck the sap out of mango plants have resulted in blackened mangoes which has led to prices of some varieties dropping to ₹7-₹8 per kg

title: WHO Chief Tedros lauds PM Modi for supporting Pandemic Accord
content: The WHO member states on Tuesday (May 20, 2025) unanimously adopted the world's first Pandemic Agreement in a move to bolster global collaboration and ensure a stronger and more equitable response to future pandemics

title: Accident-prone spots on NH 66 in Alappuzha to be identified before monsoon
content: Enforcement squad to inspect areas where NH 66 construction is under way and submit a report with recommendations to prevent accidents by the end of this week

title: Niloufer Hospital in Hyderabad launches AI-based non-invasive blood test tool
content: The AI tool works via smartphone and tablet cameras for contactless assessments and also supports longer-duration monitoring through contact-based PPG sensors

title: MPs sent to countries that have nothing to do with India-Pakistan issue: Sanjay Raut
content: Sanjay Raut criticised the Centre for sending MP delegations to unrelated countries after Operation Sindoor, calling it “showmanship” and questioning visits to nations like Liberia and Congo

title: Young cricketer’s family in Karnataka loses over ₹24 lakh to cyber fraudsters posing as IPL selectors
content: Fraudsters posing to be agents of the IPL Team Rajasthan Royals, contacted Rakesh Yadure (19), an aspiring cricketer  of Chinchani village near Chikkodi in Belagavi district

title: India reaffirms commitment to global health at World Health Assembly
content: Union Health Secretary, Punya Srivastava, underlined the transformative strides made under initiatives like Ayushman Bharat, praising India’s comprehensive healthcare

title: Elephant that died in Coimbatore was pregnant; plastic bags found in animal during post-mortem
content: The veterinarians found that that the elephant had been carrying a foetus of a male calf of 12 to 15 months old

title: Comparing Gaurav’s Pakistan visit with that of BJP stalwarts like equating apples with oranges: Chief Minister Himanta
content: Assam CM Himanta Biswa Sarma criticises Gaurav Gogoi’s Pakistan visit, alleging links to ISI, vows to reveal evidence on September 10

title: Daily Quiz | On Rajiv Gandhi’s assassination
content: Rajiv Gandhi, the youngest Prime Minister of India, was assassinated on this day in 1991. Here is a quiz on the day

title: 53 from Haryana arrested in Arunachal Pradesh for cheating in recruitment exam
content: Arunachal police uncover elaborate cheating network operated from Haryana; electronic devices seized, probe teams dispatched

title: Banu Mushtaq: A voice of empathy and resilience
content: ‘Banu Mushtaq’s short stories are written with a sense of engagement and empathy with the uncomplaining, silenced victims of moribund customs. What makes her stories distinctive is her patient attention to the details of the ordinary lives of women’

title: Telangana CM puts administration on alert in view of rain is expected over next three days
content: Officials were directed to ensure foodgrain in procurement centres is not damaged and prevent waterlogging on Hyderabad streets

title: This new Indian gin is a tribute to the forests
content: With 24 botanicals, a forest-to-bottle philosophy, and a vision rooted in mindful drinking, Vanaha is rewilding India’s spirits scene

title: Terrorists themselves gave proof of ‘Operation Sindoor’ to the world: Vice President Dhankhar
content: Vice President Jagdeep Dhankhar discusses Operation Sindoor, emphasising India’s commitment to peace, development, and economic growth at a function

title: Stir threatened in ‘neglected’ Manipur district
content: Some of the projects that have not taken off include Eklavya Model Residential School at Duibansui, Jawahar Navodaya Vidyalaya at Noney, Industrial Training Institute at Noney, and a cold storage at a suitable location

title: Pakistani intruder apprehended in Amritsar
content: BSF troops noticed the movement of a person who crossed the International Border and started approaching the border fence on May 20 evening

title: 26/11 attackers were killed but Pahalgam terrorists remain at large while govt preparing dossier: Congress
content: Senior Congress leader Jairam Ramesh asked why the terrorists behind the April 22 attack had not been arrested even after a month, pointing out 2008 Mumbai terror attackers were killed and one was arrested

title: Supreme Court refuses to entertain plea seeking FIR against Justice Varma
content: ‘The petitioner will have to seek redressal of their grievance by filing representation before the appropriate authorities rather than seek a writ of mandamus,’ the Bench said in its order

title: T.N. government moves Supreme Court to transfer PIL against laws taking away Governor’s power to appoint Vice-Chancellors
content: Says, the top court was already seized of connected matters and hence, the case filed in the Madras High Court should be transferred to the Supreme Court

title: Mohanlal turns 65, announces liver transplant aid, anti-drug drive
content: Born on May 21, 1960, Mohanlal has had an illustrious film career spanning over four decades, featuring in more than 400 films across Malayalam, Tamil, Telugu, Hindi, and Kannada

title: In his farm with five pet dogs, Booker winner Deepa Bhasthi’s husband celebrates in Kodagu
content: While the literary world applauded in London, back home in Kodagu, her win was met with joy, disbelief, and a bit of solitude

title: Telangana CM condoles Prof Jayant Narlikar’s demise; JVV recalls he actively propagated scientific temper
content: Telagana Chief Minister Revanth Reddy extended his heartfelt condolences to Professor Narlikar’s family and loved ones during this time of great loss

title: Asiatic lion population in Gujarat goes up from 674 to 891 in 5 years, footprint expands too
content: The Asiatic lions’ spread has increased across 11 districts of Saurashtra including non-forested and coastal areas

title: Has she committed murder, asks Supreme Court, granting anticipatory bail to ex-IAS probationer Puja Khedkar
content: The counsel for the Delhi Police vehemently opposed grant of anticipatory bail to the former IAS probationer, saying she was not cooperating in the probe and allegations against her were serious.

title: NH-66 collapse in Malappuram: Nitin Gadkari has promised probe, says IUML leader
content: High-level panel of experts from IIT to study structural defects and public safety risk along the stretch of under-construction national highway-66 in Malappuram, says E.T. Muhammed Basheer after meeting Gadkari in Delhi

title: Six militants arrested in Manipur with arms, ammunition
content: Three members of the banned Peoples' Liberation Army were apprehended from Langmeidong, Elangkhangpokpi and Kakching Ningthou Pareng area in Kakching district, the police said

title: Use of term 'bouncer' intended to invoke fear, terror in public mind: High Court
content: Punjab and Haryana HC has shown concern about private security agencies using the term “bouncer”, saying it promotes fear and intimidation, which has no place in a civilized society

title: Naidu launches month-long Yoga campaign in run up to World Yoga Day
content: On June 21, a massive Yoga program will be organized from R.K. Beach to Bhogapuram in Visakhapatnam, with 5 lakh participants expected to take part

title: Who is Banu Mushtaq? Kannada writer who scripted history with 2025 International Booker Prize win
content: As a writer, journalist, advocate, activist and politician, resistance and the fight for women’s rights are at the core of Banu Mushtaq’s oeuvre

title: Ashoka University professor Ali Khan Mahmudabad granted interim bail
content: The Supreme Court has directed the Haryana Police to form an SIT by May 22 to investigate the terms used in Ali Khan Mahmudabad’s posts

title: Updated top 50 MLB prospect rankings: There's a new No. 1 on our midseason list
content: Starting with a pair of players on the verge of the majors, let's rank baseball's next wave of stars.

title: Lions pull proposal to change NFL playoff seeding
content: The Lions have withdrawn their rule proposal that would have seeded the playoffs by record and not guaranteed division winners a home game.

title: Livid with plate ump, Buehler run in 3rd inning
content: Red Sox right-hander Walker Buehler, just back from the 15-day injured list, was ejected from Boston's 2-0 win Tuesday over the New York Mets in the third inning for arguing balls and strikes, and moments later, manager Alex Cora was tossed as well.

title: Panthers use right 'recipe' again, crush Canes
content: Two days removed from eliminating the Maple Leafs in Toronto, the Florida Panthers kept their road show rolling Tuesday night, cruising past the Carolina Hurricanes 5-2 in Game 1 of the Eastern Conference finals to improve to 9-4 this postseason.

title: Muncy sac fly puts end to Dodgers 4-game slide
content: Max Muncy led the Dodgers to a win in the 10th inning after Los Angeles lost four straight games, also fueled by seven shutout innings from Yoshinobu Yamamoto.

title: Jefferson's dream: Winning gold in flag football
content: After NFL owners unanimously approved allowing the league's players to play flag football at the 2028 Olympics, Vikings star Justin Jefferson said the chance of winning a gold medal is "a dream."

title: Edwards optimistic Wolves will 'figure it out'
content: Despite his team being outscored by 30 points in the second half of a lopsided 114-88 Game 1 loss to the Oklahoma City Thunder Tuesday night, Minnesota Timberwolves star Anthony Edwards was optimistic about Game 2, saying "I definitely got to shoot more."

title: Jeanty: OC wants me to ditch 'Halloween' stance
content: Raiders rookie Ashton Jeanty says that offensive coordinator Chip Kelly wants him to adjust his pre-snap stance.

title: 🏈 Projecting top NFL rookies in 10 categories
content: We predicted the NFL's top rookies in 10 different stats for the 2025 season. Who will dominate box scores this fall?

title: Inside the NBA's hand care obsession
content: Whether it's hand cream or powder, the on-court routines of NBA players have become a leaguewide obsession.

title: Reggie vs. Spike, head-butts and phantom calls: Ranking every Knicks-Pacers series
content: New York and Indiana have had some major playoff battles. Will the 2025 East finals live up to the drama?

title: Why the NBA's 26 eliminated teams should watch these conference finals
content: As four teams battle for the title, 26 teams are looking to improve -- and watching the conference finals can help.

title: No QBs allowed: We name the 25 best non-QB players for 2025
content: It's not all about quarterbacks. These players could have a big impact on 2025, even if they don't throw a pass.

title: Chaos awaits in stacked SEC baseball tournament
content: For the very first time, all 16 SEC teams will get to participate in this year's conference baseball tournament.

title: Conference finals horoscopes: Which teams will ascend? Which will go in retrograde?
content: What does the zodiac have to say about the Knicks, Thunder, Pacers and Wolves? Neil Paine shares his reading.

title: The NFL is excited about Olympic flag football, but will its stars participate? Not everyone is on board
content: A vote Tuesday paved the way for players such as Patrick Mahomes and Tyreek Hill to play Olympic flag football.

title: How FSU rallied around coach Lonni Alameda after her cancer diagnosis
content: Inside FSU softball coach Lonni Alameda's cancer experience and her support from FSU and the softball community.

title: Are the A's really playoff contenders?! An early verdict on MLB's most surprising teams
content: We offer an early postseason verdict on five of MLB's most surprising teams almost two months into the 2025 season.

title: Casemiro hails Utd's season as one of his best
content: Casemiro has called his current campaign with Manchester United, who are also in the Europa League final, "one of the most successful seasons" of his career.

title: Alonso will do 'very well' at Madrid - Carvajal
content: Real Madrid defender Dani Carvajal said "only time will tell" if Xabi Alonso can "revert the situation" following the team's disappointing season.

title: Source: Barça keen on Liverpool's Díaz
content: Barcelona are eyeing Luis Diaz to strengthen their attack next season, but they are also assessing other options due to the difficulties in signing him

title: 'Super-proud' De Bruyne: City sendoff felt 'weird'
content: Decorated Man City captain Kevin De Bruyne called his final game at City's home ground "weird" after he helped the team to 16 trophies since joining in 2015 -- a haul that includes six Premier League titles and the Champions League in 2023.

title: Ex-Sporting KC star Gadi Kinda dies at age 31
content: Former Sporting Kansas City midfielder Gadi Kinda died, his club Maccabi Haifa FC announced Tuesday. He was 31.

title: Sources: USMNT's Cardoso top target for Atlético
content: Johnny Cardoso is Atlético Madrid's top target as they look to strengthen the midfield line in the summer transfer window, sources have told ESPN.

title: Poch: Turner risks being replaced as USMNT No. 1
content: USMNT head coach Mauricio Pochettino said that he is open to giving playing time to another goalkeeper besides incumbent Matt Turner in upcoming matches ahead of the 2026 World Cup.

title: Pep tells Man City: Reduce squad size or I'll quit
content: Pep Guardiola said he would rather leave Manchester City than have to work with a bloated squad next season.

title: Angel City is a splashy, star-studded lifestyle brand. Is it ready to be a good soccer team?
content: With celebrity owners such as Natalie Portman and cool lifestyle merch drops, Angel City is a preeminent brand in women's soccer. Is being a good soccer team next?

title: Grading how every men's Big 12 basketball team performed in 2024-25
content: From BYU's run to the Sweet 16 to Colorado's 0-13 start to conference play, we evaluate all 16 teams.

title: Minnesota on top, Golden State at the bottom in Week 1
content: Minnesota, New York and Indiana are 1-2-3 in Week 1, but which team climbed eight spots from our preseason rankings?

title: NBA playoff futures: Knicks favored in East; OKC is Finals favorite
content: With the conference finals underway, here are the updated odds to win the NBA championship and Finals MVP.

title: Stanley Cup playoff odds: Panthers slight East favorites
content: Every playoff team's odds to win the 2025 Stanley Cup and favorites for the Conn Smythe Trophy for playoff MVP.

title: Transfer rumors, news: Chelsea, Liverpool, PSG want Benfica star Araújo
content: Chelsea, Liverpool and Paris Saint-Germain are in competition for Benfica defender Tomás Araújo. Transfer Talk has the latest news, gossip and rumors.Foot

title: Navy Inducts Traditionally Built Stitched Ship, A Recreation Of 5th Century Vessel
content: The Indian Navy on Wednesday inducted a traditionally built stitched ship as INSV Kaundinya, at a ceremony held at the strategically located Karwar naval base in Karnataka.

title: Bloomberg Terminal Outage Disrupts Bond Sales Across Europe
content: News and data company Bloomberg suffered an outage to its terminal for financial professionals on Wednesday, disrupting numerous government bond sales and customer activity, according to several European debt management offices and market sources.

title: Forced Conversion, Rape, Blackmail: What Probe Team Found In Bhopal Case
content: A probe committee of the National Commission for Women has made shocking revelations in the case of rape and blackmail of college girls in Bhopal, the capital of Madhya Pradesh.

title: Opinion: Opinion | Can China's Arms Market Recover From India-Pak War Embarrassment?
content: Most of China's military equipment - estimated to have cost Pakistan more than $20 billion - underperformed, missed their targets, malfunctioned, destroyed, or fell like duds in the war theatre.

title: UAE Launches Arabic Language AI Model As Gulf Race Gathers Pace
content: The United Arab Emirates launched a new Arabic language artificial intelligence (AI) model on Wednesday as the regional race to develop AI technologies accelerates in the Gulf.

title: Stepmother Strangles Daughter, Father Cremates Her. Then, Video Evidence
content: Sangeeta allegedly didn't like her stepdaughter, Madhu, and the two had frequent arguments and disagreements over household chores.

title: What Changed After Pakistan ISI Got New Chief? Top Border Officer Shares Details
content: There has been a massive increase in the recovery of weapons and the downing of drones sent by Pakistan this year, a top official guarding the border in the northwestern state has told NDTV.

title: At Ration Shop In Madhya Pradesh, Dead Get Food But The Living Struggle
content: An alleged ration scam has come to light at a distribution centre in Madhya Pradesh's Satna district in which a man who has been dead for seven years has been getting foodgrain but another, who is alive, has been struggling to do so for eight years.

title: Days After India's Taliban Outreach, China Huddles With Pakistan, Afghanistan
content: Days after S Jaishankar spoke with the Taliban's acting Foreign Minister Amir Khan Muttaqi - the first ministerial-level outreach by India to Afghanistan's Taliban regime, China has moved swiftly to organise a meeting between Islamabad and Kabul.

title: "Landmark Achievement": Amit Shah After 27 Maoists Killed In Encounter
content: As security forces have neutralised 27 Maoists in Chhattisgarh, Union Home Minister Amit Shah has termed it as a "landmark achievement in the battle to eliminate Naxalism."

title: "2 Wives In My Horoscope": Teacher Faces Case For Harassing Schoolgirl
content: A schoolteacher, who allegedly proposed marriage to a Class 9 girl, is now facing a case under the Protection of Children from Sexual Offences Act or POCSO in Rajasthan's Jodhpur district.

title: Woman's Body Found In Suitcase Near Bengaluru, Likely Thrown Out Of Train
content: A torn, blue suitcase was discovered near a railway bridge in Bengaluru on Wednesday and its contents were chilling - the body of a woman, who is suspected to have been murdered.

title: Over 46 Crore Adolescents Globally Will Be Obese By 2030, Says Study
content: The health of adolescents is at a tipping point, with more than 46 crore adolescents globally estimated to be obese and face several health and mental disorders by 2030, according to an analysis published by the Lancet Commission on Wednesday.

title: How Trump's Immigration Crackdown Threatens To Hit Columbia's Finances
content: About 40 per cent of Columbia Universitys student pool consists of international students. Students pay $70,000 plus in tuition, but international students bring to the university what Trump froze in its federal research funds, - $903.1 million.

title: No Underground Parking In Bengaluru's Low-Lying Areas In Future: DK Shivakumar
content: Karnataka Deputy Chief Minister D K Shivakumar on Wednesday said the government will soon introduce a policy prohibiting the construction of underground parking facilities in low-lying areas of the city.

title: India Lost 18,200 Hectares Of Primary Forest In 2024: Data
content: India lost 18,200 hectares of primary forest in 2024 compared to 17,700 hectares in 2023, according to the latest data from a global collaboration of over 100 organisations.

title: US Singer Chris Brown Gets Bail In Assault Case Ahead Of World Tour
content: US singer Chris Brown was on Wednesday granted bail by a London court after he was charged with a serious assault.

title: Bid To "Hoodwink The World": India Junks Pak's Charges On Suicide Bombing
content: The Ministry of External Affairs (MEA) on Wednesday dismissed Pakistan's allegation that India was trying to "foment terrorism" in the neighbouring country, saying any "attempt to hoodwink the world is doomed to fail".

title: "Understood Meaning Of Patriotism": Priyanka Gandhi's Tribute To Father Rajiv Gandhi
content: Congress MP from Wayanad, Priyanka Gandhi Vadra, paid heartfelt tribute to her late father and former Prime Minister Rajiv Gandhi on his 34th death anniversary and stated that she understood the true meaning of patriotism from her father.

title: Centre's Big Bhakra Dam Security Move Amid Punjab-Haryana Water Row
content: The central government took stern action today, deploying Central Industrial Security Forces to protect the Bhakra Dam as the Punjab-Haryana water dispute escalated.  Recently, the Punjab government had deployed police force at the dam and when the BBMB chairman went to release water, he was taken hostage. The Union Home Ministry has issued new orders asking the CISF to take charge of the Bhakra dam.  An amount of Rs 8.5 crore has been allocated and the government has approved 296 personnel of CISF. Instructions have been given to arrange for their accommodation and communication.    Track  Latest News  Live on NDTV.com and get  news  updates from  India   and around the  world

title: Ronaldo at the Club World Cup? Possible pre-June 14 moves
content: this summer, the 32-team FIFA Club World Cup runs from June 14 to July 13 in the united states . many clubs have agreed to open the summer window early for a short period from June 1-10, before closing it for six days and then re-opening again on June 16 . but the question remains: will some players end the season at one club, then play at the club world cup for another?

title: Panthers win big: Grades for both teams, players to watch for Game 2
content: the Florida Panthers beat the Carolina Hurricanes 5-2 in game 1 of the Eastern Conference finals . one team had four days to prepare, the other barely had 48 hours . a second-period lead led to the Panthers winning their 28th straight playoff game in which they led after two frames .

title: Conn Smythe Watch: Who's leading for MVP of the Stanley Cup playoffs?
